Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Ranked Third in Best Budget Inkjet Printer
Item.Review: The Artisan 50 is a compact and stylish printer form Epson that combines versatility, quality, and durability. Crisp, vibrant, and detailed photo prints are par for the course with this printer. In addition to producing great quality prints at a max resolution of 5760 x 1440 dpi, it offers speedy max print speeds of 37ppm for black and 38ppm for...

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Prints great DVDs. High quality photo printing. Easy to use and setup.
Cons: As with any ink jet, they subsidize the hardward by over charging for the ink. With six cartridges, I imagine it will add up.
Teriffic value for the money. I purchased it primarily to print DVDs. They turn out very professional looking. Well built and easy to use.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I was looking for a reasonably priced printer to use for heavier card stock, but also wanted high quality photo printing. I haven't had a chance to use it much yet, but I did a couple of test prints and found the photo quality to be exceptional. The top feed paper tray handled my card stock without difficulty. The print speed was a bit slower than I expected, but this was really not a concern for me.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This is a followup review after a period of use. I use the printer primarily for printing CDs & DVDs, I have printed about 240 disks to date and find the included software easy to use. I made a nice looking photographic background with some nice gradation-multicolored, text for titles in Microsoft publisher, then imported and added the rest of the text using the included software. The diameter settings for telling the printer the hub diameter and outside diameter work perfectly, though I find I get less overspray if I use an outside diameter 1 mm smaller than the disc. I got 234 disks printed by the time I replaced the first 3 regular size cartridges (there are 6 cartridges). I figure this is a good average number for ink/disc printing performance. I am very pleased with this pri ... nter and it's performance. I takes about 2.5 minutes to print a disc. I have only wasted 1 disk when colors ran out midway thru the printing. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 3 out of 3 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast machine with top quality photo printing. The photos on high quality paper are outstanding. Sharp type printing.
And there are drivers on the CD for Windows XP Pro and Ubuntu Linux have them too.
Cons: It's a little noisy but considering the price and quality of print it's a gem! Price of replacement cartridges.
I had to re-install the print cartridges to get the machine to run. No big deal, just make sure you push the cartridges all the way in.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Really nice job on CD printing
Item.Review: We bought this printer primarily to print labels on CDs. I have used Microsoft Publisher, Photoshop and our own pictures to produce the background image which includes some nice titles and effects that exceed the capability of the included software. I then import the image and add additional text. This has worked GREAT! The image prints exactly on the disk as it is displayed on the screen. Print time is about 2&1/2 min. per disk. I don't know if that's fast or slow but is workable for us. The printer has a small footprint and both the paper input and output trays fold up neatly which not only takes up less space but keeps dust out of the machine. I read a review that described the artisan 50 printer as noisy. I don't find it any louder than any other inkjet we've had so I wonde ... r if that wasn't and individual quirk. However, we have had one problem. The paper output tray must be switched from the paper slot to the CD slot in order to print on CDs. This is a very simple task but once the printer kept giving error messages saying the CD tray was improperly installed (it wasn't). Finally I ran a test print on paper & then switched the tray. For whatever reason this seemed to cure the problem. To summarize, I found the software very easy to use, the CD print quality is excellent with no hassles aligning the image on the disk. I think it's hard to go wrong with all the good points and low cost of this machine. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this printer to print photos and notecards of my scanned artwork. The paper moves through effortlessly and smoothly; the colors are vibrant; and the printing speed is quick for this size inkjet printer. It's very quiet, and has a relatively small footprint. I would strongly recommend it.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great printer. Works on a PC
Item.Review:
Pros: Accurate Colors; Easy Setup; Fast Print Time; Easy To Use; Reliable
Cons: Large Footprint
Had to review this printer after the apple user review. Works fine in windows 7. I've printed 1000 5x7's on it so far, without any problem.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: High quality prints, low price.
Prints excellent quality photos quickly. I've also read good things about the durability of the Claria inks that it uses. Low price and solid construction make it a bargain for color prints. Anyone printing black and white photos on a regular basis will probably want a printer with gray ("light black") ink tanks (expensive). But for most of us wanting nothing larger than 8x10 color photos this does the job admirably. Highly recommended.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This product is very useful. I use it ONLY for printing on CDs as I have another printer already for documents.... and the ink for this printer is quite pricey. It is fairly easy to setup and use and once you have used the included program once and printed to CD, it is quite easy to use. I had a small issue with installing the ink when I first installed it, but once I got through that it has been flawless. The CD printing program can be a little quirky but I can make it do what I need. For the price, this is a tremendous purchase!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: We use this printer for high quality artwork and photos. On straight photo setting it is about the same speed as our old R800 and quite a bit slower for best photo. For the price, it fills our needs quite well.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Handy/OK for CDs and letter type things
Item.Review: Since I got the Artisan 50 for CD printing and not photos, I'm pretty happy with it. The colors are a bit drab, but really, I'm happy to print on CDs with it even photos on cd are ok, and letters/documents on plain paper are fine. I'd avoid this one for photos personally unless you don't need nice photo printing. For the money it's just fine, but spend a lot more on better if you want nice photos.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Absolutely superb print quality. Black text is perfectly formed, crisp and sharp. Color photos on high-quality glossy paper are stunning. I'm delighted with this purchase.
Cons: Printer didn't work out of the box. After speaking with Epson on the phone it was decided that I'd received a defective Light-Cyan cartridge. The service tech explained that the cartridges aren't covered under warranty. I had to go to a local office supply store and purchase the cartridge (15 bucks) to get the printer to work.SHAME ON YOU EPSON AMERICA for not warranting the entire contents of the box.
Kudos to Newegg for their incredible service and prompt shipping. I ordered the printer on Tuesday afternoon and it was at my door on Thursday morning. It just don't get no better than that!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Accurate Colors; Fast Print Time; Great Overall Quality; Easy Setup; Easy To Use
Cons: I wish it printed 11x14
This is a great printer and the price makes it even better. I'm not sure what problems the other mac user had but set up was simple. Yes the supplied disk is out of date but I had an automatic update to the latest drivers from the epson web site.(osx10.6.4) The colors are ok out of the box. I highly recommend calibrating for best color. After calibration (I use color monkie) the colors are spot on. The foot print is excellent. It fits on my desk with room to spare. I wish they could get printers this size capable of printing 11x14 (17.7"footprint) I might have to step up to the R1900 for that. Not looking forward to 24.3" foot print.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Prints fine art papers, color & B&W
Item.Review: Here's info I couldn't find before buying this printer, and it's very important. I use an Epson Pro 3880 for my fine-art photo printing, but I also need an everyday printer for businesss documents, web printing, and good quality photos and greeting cards. I especially wanted to use the better papers for the photo and art apps (when I didn't feel it necessary to fire up the big gun) and I was delighted to learn the Artisan 50 would take heavyweight papers without a problem and print very good quality, too. Not as good as the Pro 3880, of course, but still quite good. For my tests, I tried Moab cotton rag 300 gsm and Hahnemuhle Natural Art Duo at 256 gsm for the better matte papers, plus Moab Colorado Fiber Gloss 245 and Innova Fibaprint White Gloss f-type300 gsm for the semi-gloss papers (t ... he latter two are better than anything Epson makes). The Artisan 50 took the heavier papers just fine and, although the color and contrasts were different than the 3880, I was able to make PhotoShop adjustments to get good prints on all of them in color, although the Innova White Gloss F-type didn't perform as well in color. The Moab Colorado Fiber Gloss 245 was best for color in semi-gloss (better than the Epson papers and you can use the Epson ultra premium semi-gloss setting). Next, I tried black and white on the two semi-gloss papers -- the Moab Colorado Fiber Gloss 245 and the Innova Fibaprint White Gloss F-type 300 -- and the Artisan 50 printed both of these very well. But it required some adjusting to get a neutral or warm tone print. When I checked the black and white/grayscale box under advanced tab it printed a cool tone print with a very slight purplish cast. The print quality was surprisingly good and it was similar to what you'd get with cold tone developers and selenium toning in the darkroom. As is, this is good when you want a cold tone print. But I wanted to see if I could make a neutral or slightly warm print, so I switched off the black and white and switched on color controls and also Epson Standard in color mode (all under advanced tab).Next, in PhotoShop, I made a duplicate layer and overlaid a yellow filter, as follows: Image= Adjustments= Photo Filter= Yellow at 10% with preserve luminosity, and this knocked out the purple. I then made a new layer with Image= Adjustments= Photo Filter= Sepia 10% with preserve luminosity, and this warmed it up a bit. These two filters -- 10% yellow and 10% sepia -- flattened the contrast a little, so I boosted the contrast in levels and with these adjustments I got very beautiful neutral tone black and white prints on both papers. And had I wanted more warmth I could have easily increased the sepia or overlaid another warm filter or color in a small amount. All of my tests were done with either photo or best photo settings, and the best photo provides a barely noticeable improvement, so if you don't need it, you can save ink by using photo which still prints up very nicely. By the way, for business plain paper printing, I tried both draft and text settings, and the draft mode prints quite faint and I found that unacceptable. This is an amazing printer for[...], and it doesn't even matter if it lasts very long because, since a set of inks is $60, the printer is just $39. Easy enough to buy a new one. I also like that you can get the series 77 ink cartridges that hold 50% more ink. I didn't see these at B&H yet, but they do have them on the Epson website, so if you do more than just occasional printing, this is the way to go. I'm very pleased with this printer. It's easy to use, takes the thicker papers, handles the everyday printing with good speed, and does afine job on color printing, and will even produce good quality black and white prints with a little PhotoShop work. Finally, it has settings for Envelope and CD printing, plus a quiet mode for plain paper printing, which is great when you need to print a 30 page document and don't want the noise. All in all, an amazing printer for the price! expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Love it and a great price!
Item.Review: Great quality photos for use in DVD folios and printing disks, espicially for the price. The ony thing I'm not big on is you have to place the disk printer into the tray. It is a flimsy piece of plastic and has to be placed in just so. After a few times, it becomes easier. Ink is expensive, but that goes without saying.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I purchased this printer because you can print directly onto the CD/DVD and I needed it for my photo design business. It works like a charm. Very easy setup - no fuss. The CD/DVD look very professional and I am happy! I would have given it 5 stars, but one of the inks displayed as being low and it was brand new. Perhaps it had sat on the shelf for a while. Regardless, I replaced the light cyan and everything is fine. I was also just as excited about B&H Photo for the price,[...] and everything. Thanks!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Great printer - top quality prints. I use especially for printing on CDs and DVDs. Easy to set up and use. Inks are cheap ... $6/cartridge...and i don't need to buy a whole package...one at a time as needed. I haven't found anything that I don't like about it as yet. Cheers!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Printer, prints on DVD/CD printable media
Item.Review:
Pros: great price, prints on DVD/CD printable media, great colors and prints pretty quickly
Cons: not a ton of features
I got this because it is great value. It is cheap because it does not have a ton of features or lcd screens, etc. But it does print to DVD/CD printable media and that is why I wanted it. It does a great job of everyday printing and photo printing but its DVD.CD printing is why I got it and plus it is low price. I highly recommend this machine.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I purchase this product mainly because I can print on a printable DVD/CD. Setup was easy and the print quality is great for the price. I have another Epson printer which works great so it was easy for me to trust this product. The down side to the Epson line of printers is the fact they make a loud noise while printing. Please note: I have never used neither of my Epson printers to print Photos. So my comments are solely base on everyday document and CD/DVD label printings.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Fell literally in love with Epson's R200 and R220, but both bit the dust. Was hesitant in going the Artisan 50 route as a replacement, but bit the bullet and have been absolutely elated. There's not another printer out there that will compare to this one for the price. Excellent color, print speed...you name it!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Most of my photos go to the computer or to a professional printer. I use this one in house for small stuff. For the price and size, it is great. My HP 8450 was using ink like water. This is producing beautiful colors and minimal ink usage. The black / white have a slight color cast, but all single black printers do. If I want a large B/W , with excellent tone, I will send it out.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Very fast on both printing CD/DVDs and the labels. Really pretty quiet....you can choose silent mode in setup. Comes with the software to make labels(excellent). Very quick setup.
Cons: Just like most inkjets, the ink costs more than a new printer.
Bought this printer last week to do a customer job. 100 dvds and the jackets. It got here in 2 days!Did the entire job on the supplied ink! Newegg has the best deal on this printer, if you need to print directly on cds/dvds, this is the one for you!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great buy at a great price.
Item.Review: The printer was easy to install on my Macbook Pro and the printing quality has been very good for my personal documents and photos. Although replacement ink can be on the high side, I found a wholesale ink vendor.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Purchase the Artisan 50 as a replacement for Rx580, 90% of use is to print Photos edited using Adobe Cs4. The inkpads were saturated after three years of intensive use. I had been satisfied with the ink set on Kodak ultra paper so searched for a photo printer only, using the same ink set as the Rx580. I seldom use the Rx580 scanner as I have an Epson V500 to scan my negatives (Kodak ProEkta). Artisan is quieter than the Rx580 and a bit faster and I like the real time ink level indicator. I noticed a magenta bias in the prints, especially the skin tones, somewhat like prints from old Fuji negatives ??? this was not apparent using the identical paper and ink set from my old Photo Shop files. A correction in CS4, color, hue, red (+15-24), solved the problem. Using the RAW editor, hue, ... red +35 or so, seems to do the trick also. This magenta shift (?) is not noticeable in my scanned images from either Kodak ProEkta or Portrait Pro using 16bit channels. I am satisfied with the Artisan 50 printer, excellent price/performance. The setup was simple, I downloaded the files from the Epson website as the setup disk files were out of date for my Mac 10.5+. The only issue is the paper print settings, which is not as user friendly/flexible as the old Rx580 ??? not a big issue but a minor annoyance. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Home printer for school work and photos Very easy to set up on Vista and Ubuntu through Synology NAS. Photo quality is great. Too early to tell how long the printer cartridges last.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Good for its prime purpose - printing disc labels
Item.Review:
Pros: Good quality at a reasonable price
Cons: Lack of ability to input from SD or other chip storage
I purchased this printer to replace my Epson Stylus Photo R320 which quit working after a bit over 2 years of heavy use. My primary use of my Epson printers is to print disc labels on DVD and CD inkjet printable discs and considering the fact that no other company produces a comparable product at such a reasonable price, I will likely continue to purchase and use Epson printers in the future. My only real complaint regarding this printer is that while I'd like to use Epson OEM ink cartridges, they are priced too high to be a viable option. Considering the number of cartridges I use each year, it's cheaper to use reloaded cartridges and replace the printer when it dies than to ... pay up to three times as much for Epson cartridges. As an example, purchasing approximately 15 reloaded cartridges saves me enough over the price of Epson cartridges (about $130) to pay for another new printer!! Other than this problem, I give Epson printers a very high rating, including my new Artisan 50 printer. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: My Artisan 50 is used for quality color prints and for labeling DVDs or CDs. It installed easily on my W7 64bit system and worked as described. I use Pictorico Ultra Premium Luster Photo Paper and the results are outstanding. The DVD labeling feature has worked flawlessly so far and I'm quite happy since my older P200 is not supported in W7. Its not as speedy as I'd like, but I'll trade for the quality any time. Qimage is my print engine and it seems totally compatible with the Artisan 50.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Purchased this product to print unedited photos basically right out the camera. Will print a 4X6 color photo in 10-12 seconds. Clear crisp accurate color. Easy set up, good directions and easy to use. I have printed about 600 4X6 photos and a few 8X 10's No Complaints.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Sharp Tones & Colors; Great Contrast; Accurate Colors; Easy Setup; Easy To Use
Cons: Noisy; Pricey Ink Replacement
I have been using this to make note cards. The colors are every bit as good as my wide format much more expensive Epson printer. It is a tad on the noisy side and the feel of it is indicative of a less expensive unit. The process of setting print sizes is a bit unwieldy but once you get used to it; okay. It will be interesting to see how it holds up and maintains this quality over an extended period of time. One suggestion I would have is to not let the printer "fix photo". When I have failed to undo this box the printer has tended to wash out some of the vibrancy of color in my photos.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Printer for print to disk
Item.Review: I had the previous version of this printer for about 5 years and then it started to misprint and print in funny colors. Tried everything to get it fixed but ended up getting this new version. It ahs held up the same so far and prints when I ask it to. I don t print much so I should probably at least print one sheet a week or month and it won t do what the previous one did. But other than that I think it is an excellent printer. Especially if you are looking to print to dvd or cd discs.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice product & Price point for labels
Item.Review: I love the price for the cd/dvd labeling the artisan does. The ink lasted longer then I thought it would but refill kits are available including continuous. Had trouble with the ink cartiges moving across to access, seems you have to press the ink button with the top up. The on button takes a couple of pushes to turn on, strange, then it goes through some cleaning it looks like don't know if it uses ink though. The pictures on the disc look great my customers are happy to get these great looking disc. They really need to supply a USB cord especially when they say it's the recommended hookup.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Got this printer based on the reviews here. Worked great for the first 2 months; beautiful prints, very crisp, good colors (once you get the settings right). At that point, I would have given it 5 stars. But then it stopped working mid way through a print. Started leaving light bands, purple bands, couldn't print the right colors, etc. I wasted a ton of ink and paper doing all the trouble shooting suggestions, replaced ink, etc. Finally spent 2 hours on the phone with Epson customer service repeating this whole process and they finally admitted it has a hardware problem. To their credit though they immediately shipped a new replacement completely free of charge. So we'll see how long the next one works. I hope it holds up as I really did love this printer until it stopped working. I guess ... I'd recommend it but keep your receipt and warranty handy! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: For my photo business (printing sports photos on site) I rely on my printers to be great quality. I recently bought this printer with the intention of using it for printing my cd/dvd's for my digital images. On the weekend, my main printer failed (not an Epson Product) I had no choice but to use my Epson Artisan 50. I must tell you that I was plesantly surprised by the print quality. I changed the default settings to quality instead of speed and the photos were amazing. Glad I purchased this printer.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This is my 2nd Epson Artisan 50. I love this printer because it let's me print on CD and DVD and rough drafts of jewel case inserts. The colors are amazing, especially when you use glossy paper. The only thing you have to watch out for is cheap chinese ink refills. don't buy the cheapest. get a quality refil and you'll be fine.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Prints excellent CD's and DVD's. Does a nice job on color pictures. Fast at printing standard documents. There's nothing fancy about the design of the printer (no sprung hinges for the front or top covers, you manually move the output paper tray to the CD printing position) but seems to be built well. The output on printing DVD's well exceeds the quality of my older Stylus R1800 but haven't tested how well they'll endure smearing or being handled since it doesn't use pigment inks. Great printer for the price. Would have given it 5 stars but I've only had it for a month and can't speak to how reliable it may or may not be.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: If you are looking for decent printer without having to spend a lot of money, this is a good choice. It does a very good job of printing clear and sharp pictures. If you have the ability to calibrate the printer's ICC profiles you will be even more impressed with this printers capabilities.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: We print to DVDs. This printer is easy to use and prints beautifully. It's not particularly fast. But, if you print small quantities the quality and price are top notch.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Overall Quality; Accurate Colors; Fast Print Time
Cons: Pricey Ink Replacement
Prints quality prints on any quality substrate. I'm happy that I purchased the 50 and highly recommend it to all artists.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Prints Discs Beautifully
I have been producing videos for 10 years, mostly of my kids' sporting events and school functions. I have done a few other things. For about 7 years I have been using an Epson R300 to print photo-realistic artwork on the discs themselves. Well, after many years, the R300 is now leaving streaks across the discs. No amount of cleaning has helped. I think I wore out the print head.
Time to look for a new printer (in a hurry because I have a project to get out the door). Enter the Epson Artisan A50. Since I really don't do this to turn a profit, money was an issue. And, I needed it quick. I saw the A50 in "another store" but was concerned about the rather cheap look and feel. After doing more research, I just couldn't find another printer for which ... I could justify spending more money.
Local Best Buy stores had none in stock, so I ordered one shipped to a local store. They estimated 4-7 days for pickup. In just two days (today) I received notice that I could pick it up. I brought it home and set it up. I immediately started printing my waiting project. It was an OMG moment. The pictures that have a lot of blacks and bright colors look AWESOME, better than the R300 ever did them.
Granted, this is not a large sample yet, but the combination of the A50 printing on the new Verbatim AquaAce glossy disc blanks just pops!
In short, it's not the fastest printer and I haven't printed anything other than DVDs, but that's what I bought it for. My color laser does everything else. Maybe I'll try some photo paper sometime. If you need a printer to label CDs and DVDs, this one is pretty good. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice Printer, getting the job done
Item.Review: For the price you can't beat this printer. I had an old R220 that finally gave up on me. This has been a great replacement. Good for short runs. There are few dvd printers out there and this is worth checking out.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I've had this printer for about two weeks now and I'm pretty much just using it for CDR and DVDR printing. So far, it's worked well and was easy to set up by following the instructions carefully. Disc buring is SLOW (about 2 minutes per disc), so it's probably not the right machine for you if you're planning on doing large batches of discs, but the software works well and I've been very happy with the print quality on regular white Taiyo Yuden inkjet-ready discs.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Very nice, simple to use printer
Item.Review:
Pros: The Quality of the printer/Bestby price
Cons: as with any printer the cost of the ink
This is my second Artisan 50 printer. I gave my first one to my son. I like the handy way this one works I bought a new one and kept using from my Ink supply. I've gone thru a klot of printers in 30 yrs and the Artisan 50 is the best.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: My Epson R220 needed to be replaced and I was just about to purchase another R220 when a friend told me to check out the Artisan 50 and I am glad he did. This printer is just as good as the R220 but at a lesser price. I mainly use this printer for printing on CD/DVD's and the quality and speed is wonderful. Thank you Epson and B & H, you are the best.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Can't Beat it for the price
Item.Review: Great little printer for color images. I take it on location for quick print outs of a project. People love the fast great color prints that they can take with them.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Well, I'm no expert but the prints are stunning. I'm not going to spend $500 to print some pictures of my dog and my truck. I am very pleased with what I got for less than a hundred bucks. I had some Canon paper lying around. Colors were way off. I had some Kodak works with any printer paper lying around. Horrible, horrible. When my Epson Luster paper arrived I got prints that matched my Photoshop screen. Obviously the paper is important but the printer works great. No issues. B&H price was the best by far.[...] Of course, they almost give away the printer so they can sell you ink. I may try continuous ink or refillable. 5 stars, bravo Epson and B&H.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I was looking for a printer that could produce quality prints in a short period of time. This printer can turn out B&W prints faster than any other affordable printer that I have owned. The added benefit for my use is the quality of colors when I print pictures.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I've only made a few prints so far but am very pleased. I printed on Red River Paper's Ultra Pro Satin paper using their paper profiles, and the prints are great. The colors match my screen and there is plenty of detail in the deep shadows.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Used primarily to print on CDs and DVDs this is a simple yet versatile tool. Just about plug and play , bundled with all the software needed for the task. I would recommend this sturdy photo printer that also renders crisp, true color prints, to a friend without exception.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I Upgraded To The Epson Artisan 50 Printer...A World Of Diffrence In Speed And Quality. 5x7 Color Photos Lighting Fast. The Only Negative Thing I See Might Be The Cost Of Replacing The Cartridges... Thumbs Up

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I looked at the review, bought this printer for photo printing, I wanted to love it like everyone else, but it's a piece of sh#t. From day one, I've had on and off again printing problems, some days it works well, the next day it has lots of lines. I've done it all, cleaned the head, etc. I've used so much ink cleaning and checking the heads that I hardly get any printing done. I've decided to look for a new printer, but the question becomes, another Epson or do I try a Canon. I can't wait to get rid of this one!!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: As a pro videographer I need a printer to label my DVDs. This printer is a good fit. If you print thousands of DVDs every year, you need an automated burner/printer, but if you just need to bang out smaller runs this one is for you. You can't beat the price for its performance. I wish the ink cartridges were cheaper but such is life.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The printer is one of the best I have used in a long time. I do graphic design work and the proofs that this Epson Artisan 50 printer produces are fantastic! The service with Mac Connection was just as good as the printer. I will buy from them again!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Prints discs very satisfactorily until the heads start spotting. I usually replace it about once a year, which is over 1000 discs. Since the replacement includes new ink, it's like getting it a half price.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I purchased the Artisan 50 to replace my Epson Stylus Photo 220. The Artisan 50 is much faster and it is far easier to load DVD's for label printing. I have printed to both Matte Film adhesive backed labels and on printable DVD's. The results are professional in appearance...colors more saturated than on the 220. I am very glad I made the purchase.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: * Don't judge a book by its cover
Item.Review: As a professional photographer, I purchased this to replace my Epson 280R. Its just a simple desktop printer, that not does more than just my paperwork and CD/DVD printing. I can print out terrific 8x10 or full bleed letter sized images for portfolio's. The only drawback I have is that it's almost identical to the 280R printer. Same ink & almost same exact design. I just hope this one holds up a little better than the last. FYI: I only buy epson printers..

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Good product at a good price
Item.Review: I have attached the Artisan 50 printer to a new iMac computer and it works very well; faster than the the R220 it replaced. Local stores had none on hand even at higher prices[...]

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought this printer mainly to print on DVD's but cannot believe how well it prints on Photo Paper as well. The CD bed is very easy to load, much better than my previous printer, and very quiet! I have 2 pro printers attached to other computers but found that the Artisan 50 Inkjet Printer is so handy to use that I have now started printing quality prints on it also.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: It's a printer. Nothing else. No scanner, card-readers, nothing. It's exactly what I need. It does one thing and does it very well.It has a simple pass-through paper feeder, which I like very much. Color prints are awesome. Of course it's just 6-ink based printer and it's dye ink but still it manages to produce impressive results. B&W prints are fine two, all what you need is to find right paper (I found less brighter, more heavy ones produce decent results).

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This printer is a great printer for the price. I had one that the printer head went bad on and found the Artisan 50, it has less options, but that's ok if you're needing a printer for cd printing. It does a great job printing on the cd's so far. I don't like the way the tray has to be changed from paper to cd. It's a little clumsy. The other printer I had, you used a lever to change the tray. After getting use to it though it's works fine.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: As a professional photographer, I purchased this to replace my Epson 280R. Its just a simple desktop printer, that not does more than just my paperwork and CD/DVD printing. I can print out terrific 8x10 or full bleed letter sized images for portfolio's. The only drawback I have is that it's almost identical to the 280R or 320R printer. Same ink & almost same exact design. I just hope this one holds up a little better than the last. FYI: I only buy epson printers...

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: For the price this is a great little photo printer. Shooting and printing 8x10s, in full color, at an event on site. Only down side was it took a little longer than I would have liked for it to print out, but the quality and price are spot on. Would highly recommend the Artisan 50 printer.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Just like the R200 and R220 that have been tossed out, this one is about to be tossed due to the tray errors. I have to hard boot it almost every disc now. I have reloaded software several times and these fixes from Epson are short lived. The discs look great, especially on silver discs, but plan on replacing on a regular basis to keep the aggravation and cuss words to a minimum.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: I use it only to print DVD's and they look awesome comparing to my Primera duplicator.
Cons: The printer complain about nonsenses all the time. Refusing to print - have to reset it, just to print one DVD. Big pain to make it work.
I wish brother will print on DVD's. Will never have to deal with epson poor mechanics.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Very good printer for home use.
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Photos; price; Lack of unwanted features
Cons: Ink cost
This printer was a replacement for a 6 year old Epson. What a great improvement. Great 8 by 10 and smaller photos. Good job Epson.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Epson Artisan 50 printer is a good buy
Item.Review: The Artisan 50 came from B&H Photo and was shipped very fast. The printer was packed very well and had no problem finding everything I needed. I had two problems I think are worth mentioning. It took me 3 times to set up the driver for the Epson. I have installed many printers and know how to do it well. I would get all the way through the installation process and was informed that the computer could not find the Epson. I would uninstall and try again three times before it took. The second problem was that it was not printing very well. This was just stuck ink nozzles as this cleared up after purging the ink cartridges. When all said and done, the printer makes fine prints. It does a great job! I would recommend this printer to anyone that would like a great photo printer for a very re ... asonable price! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: This printer features a low price, great results on printing mixed text and photos and the ability to print on cd/dvd media. It is reasonably speedy for printing mixed text and photos. 5 eggs for value, a very good printer for the price.
Cons: Get a printout wet, and it no longer looks so good. A little slower on CDs than the R800, but a much less expensive printer. Dye based printers do not print archive worthy photos.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Does it all and I mean all!!
Item.Review:
Pros: The CD/DVD to print option
Cons: I wish it was smaller
I work offshore in the oilfield down here in the Gulf of Mexico. I have no set schedule and work on call 24/7, so portability is super important. The unit is nicely compact (even though I do wish it was smaller). I was going to buy the Dymo Disk Painter for $300.00 but it has been discontinued and no one else makes a disk painter of similar size and/or cost. I saw the Epson Artisan at work by another contractor and was extremely impressed. I ordered one before I even came back to land. As an Energy Consultant (my own business) I am constantly looking for an extra edge that separates me from the other consultants. The professional imagery I can put onto the DVD's is that edge. Why settle for someone just using a magi ... c marker. And the other thing...my covers look better from the field than do the data recording companies finalized reports with their DVD covers; and for under $150 bucks. Now if you guys ever make a stand alone CD/DVD disk painter (for a good price) then you call me immediately, because I am buying the first two. (one for the home office and one for the field.) I love this unit. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Epson, it doesn't get any better...!
Item.Review: Artisan 50 Inkjet Printer by Epson...What can I say, there is no way to describe the quality and satisfaction that comes with a purchase from B&H. The Artisan is only one of many in the field of electronics. This photo printer has too many features to mention here, the end result is fantastic. Epson paper,ink, and the Artisan 50-there is no other way to go. Thanks B&H, Bob Martino

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I have always used Epson Printers ,I purchased the Artisan 50 to use with my Photobooth setup, first of all for the speed advertised, altho I couldn't duplicate the fastest speed they advertised I did get 4 X 6 Prints in about 20 sec. in some cases.I was overall pleased with the Printer.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy Setup; Easy To Use; Does boarderless easily; Great Overall Quality; Sharp Tones & Colors; Fast Print Time
Cons: Noisy; Pricey Ink Replacement
This is not a copier or a scanner, but it is a great photo printer. It seems like it doesn't use as much ink as my HP printers do. I have printed 11 8.5 X 11 prints and the ink levels are just starting to drop.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: This is my second Artisan 50 printer
Item.Review: I am a professional photographer and use the Artisan 50 to make small prints and greeting cards. I also have a large Epson 7880 printer, and side by side 7 x 10 prints from the 2 printers are indistinguishable in quality. The first test print I made was nearly perfect, and only very small adjustments were needed to set up the printer. It made good prints straight out of the box

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I have this printer and for the life of me I can not figure out why they ever made this one I go through more ink as the heads constantley need cleaning sometimes after only One photo and the color starts to decided for itself what it should look like Before this I had a epson 380 photo best printer I ever had but as it goes if you have something that works it goes out of production

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Perfect replacement for the R220
Cons: Nothing
I had 6 R220 printers because the output quality is fantastic and ink cheap. I finally couldn't find any more 200 or 220s so I did a search for a replacement. I was not disappointed. The Artisan 50 is just as cheap to run, just as good quality and TWICE the speed. What's not to love? Pastorrob

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice for printing CDs and DVDs
Item.Review: I bought this to replace the R1800 I was using to print images and logos on CDs and DVDs. Mainly because of its smaller footprint. The print quality is better than the R1800. I won't be printing much beyond CDs, DVDs and some documents on it (I have a 3880 for art work). However, this is very nice for what its purpose. Set up very easily on my Mac Book Pro

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I was looking for an Inkjet printer only as I have fax, scan, and copy machines. This is a reasonably priced acceptable photo printer that does a very good normal print job. The draft mode comes out with a brown/tan hue that is okay but not as good as my previous Canon S530D photo printer. The ink cartridges are a bit pricey. I recommend this to anyone looking for a good inkjet printer.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The price is right [$] for a printer that does 2 tasks for me. One is printing text or pictures and the clarity looks great for me. But the real resaon I bought the printer was to print labels directly on DVD's and CD's. Once you buy printable DVD's & CD's (especially the shiny ones) you can print your labels one by one with each label taking a minute or 2. Over the long run, the real cost is refilling the ink cartridges because one complete set costs the same as the entire printer. I highly recommend this printer.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am very satisfied with the performance of this printer, especially the faster speed and the excellent quality, besides the installation and the printing are easy to handle.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought this to do CD printing. The ink that comes with this is NOT water resistant on CDs. I only made one CD with it before I swapped the ink for a CISS system with pigment ink. The printer is finicky when it comes to CDs and sometimes it spits the tray out and makes you turn off the printer, delete the print job, and turn the printer back on. This is a pain because the printer takes a few minutes to reinitialize. The one good thing about the printer is that it is pretty fast when there are no errors.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This is primarily used for CD/DVD label printing with an occasional photo or document printed. Getting it to print on a DVD was a bit awkward at first with a front tray error, but that seems to have corrected itself. Once I got past that little item, the quality was outstanding.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: In just over a year it went dead. Would not turn on. Made so it is not repairable. In otherwords it couldn't be fixed. Past warranty so no replacement. This was a replacement for an HP that did the same thing a year earlier. Printer companies need to go back to the old way of making repairable products that hold up over time. The printer when it worked did a decent job on printable disks and the occasional photo. We didn't use this printer a lot but made sure we did print once a month to keep ink system flowing and maintained. Overall a huge dissapointment. No one could pull the electronics from the machine to diagnose and repair problem as it's put together in way that prevents that with plastic tabs interlocked etc. Since we had nothing to lose we did attempt to zero in on exact failure ... but as predicted plastic tabs broke and therefore we do not recommend this printer. I've got a Photo 2000 and now worry that expensive Epson will eventually fail in the same manner. Deserves no more than one star when it can't last 1 year let alone 5. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Accurate Colors; Great Contrast; Fast Print Time; Great Overall Quality; Easy To Use; Reliable; Sharp Tones & Colors; Easy Setup
Restoring Historical Photos

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I've used Epson printers for several years with mixed results. The CD printing quality on the 1800, for example, was just average. I was a little hesitant to buy another Epson, but the Artisan 50 blew me away. You can't beat this printer for the simplicity, price and awesome output quality.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast speed and good quality
Cons: Not wireless
I have been using this printer for around a month now. It has great color and photos look amazing. I have also used it for documents. They are good too. It is very fast compared to my old HP all-in-one. I like that this printer isn't so bulky. Some of the other printers were just huge. I have a black/white laser printer for most of my work stuff and I only use this one when I need color. It is saving me lots of dollars in ink.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this printer for printing photos while traveling in our RV. I needed a good photo printer but wanted to be able to print the occasional document also. Very happy with the results, no negatives.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought this printer primarily to print directly on CDs and DVDs but it is fast and works so well, it is now my default printer. I am using Windows 7 and the drivers and CD/DVD printing software work great. The Picture printing software would not install, but I will use my other printer for photos, so it's not a serious problem.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I solely bought this to print lables on DVD. Works great if you only need to print a few DVDs at a time. I've done as many as 15 of the same lable. I did have to feed each DVD into the printer but it sure beats a sharpie. One quirk, you need to put paper out-put tray in lower position (non DVD position) to load ink cartridges.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I make 8x10 prints of the carving and wood working things that I make for a work booke, The pest prints i have had easy without touchu using a Leica digilux 3 with leica d vario elmarit E72 lense.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought this to replace my Epson Stylus 260 which we wore out by printing over 2000 CD's. This printer takes the same ink cartridges, which was good for me. It is smoother and faster than the old model, and an incredible value at [$]. It is a good (not great) photo printer, but that is not why I bought it. It is an excellent color or b/w document printer.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: I bought this to print to CD/DVDs
Item.Review: I bought this to print to CD/DVDs. This printer is easy to use and prints beautifully. I did not buy this printer for speed but for quality of print. This is my third Epson printer for printing CD/DVDs. I had the R-200 and R-260. They all did what I bought them for. The CD/DVD tray on the R-200 was a little weak but it did the job. For an inexpensive printer and it is inexpensive relatively speaking, I'm happy with it.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This printer works great, dose everything I bought it to do, makes great photos and prints on my white DVDs. Just one problem, the other day I was printing and it was doing a great job, then the lights started flashing, it said the the flashing code ment that the internal parts had reached their life expectancy. ( you print so many pages, then it stops working, even if everything is still printing great. It is like they programed it to stop after so many pages are printed..) That is crazy! I love this printer and I print alot of photos with it.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Great Overall Quality; Accurate Colors; Great Contrast; Sharp Tones & Colors; Easy Setup; Fast wireless; Reliable; Fast Print Time
I use the printer for people and pet photography using a DSLR (Canon Rebel EOS.) The printed colors are true and brilliant if the photos are as such.
At the time that I bought it, there was no driver for it for Mac OS X Lion, but as of 2/15/12 there is now a driver online.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I currently have two of these printers on my system. I use one for general document printing and the other for photo and DVD printing. This is one of the few printers that prints on printable DVD and CD media and with excellent quality.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought this to print on cds and dvds and have been thrilled with both the ease of use and quality of the finished product. I have heard nothing but positive feedback from my customers.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: That printer has a huge footprint, nearly as big as my old tabloid printer. I'm using it primarily for DVD printing. Quality is superb. The software is a bit cheesy, but it works. Templates for DVD/BD jackets would have been nice. Print quality on paper is terrific. Shame that Epson doesn't have too many offerings on pearl or semi-glossy paper. The disk with OS 10.6 drivers was seemingly thrown into the box as an after thought. Both my OS 10.5 iMac and 10.6 MacBook give problems with the drivers for the DVD cartridge. You have to delete your print job, take out the cartridge, restart the printer, replace cartridge and pray....

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Does a great job on CD/DVD printing and printed pictures look great. Very fast. Easy set-up. This is just what I needed. I've got an older HP wireless in the house that has been a workhorse and everyone can use wirelessly but now I can keep this by my side at our main computer to print anything special.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I print only photos, the only problem I have is the noise when it starts but this is common on most printers, BEST AND UNBELIEVABLE SERVICE BELONGS TO B&H, and if I give 5 stars on printer I ALSO GIVE 10 STARS TO B&H. Take a note, buy a full capacity ink with only $15-20 more but you get 60% more ink

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The colors and tonal range are nice. However, It's reproduction of yellows oranges and reds are always over saturated. For an inexpensive printer, I didn't expect much for quality and this printer has exceeded my expectations for print quality. It produces very acceptable images. The one star rating is due to the reoccurring paper jams. It normally takes me 10 attempts before the paper goes through and prints. I was patient at first, but now after several months I can't stand it anymore. I'm about to go office space on this piece of junk. I forgot to mention that black and white prints are terrible; there's a magenta cast on all prints.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This printer upgrades my Epson Stylus Photo R260 and is faster, quieter, and does an equal or better job for overall quality and color. I use it for greeting cards, for photos to 8.5 by 11, and in my work as a newsletter editor.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: It was just what I was looking for
Item.Review: I've worked many years in the graphic design field. I edit pictures, do slides shows,create business cards, CD/DVD covers,print brochures,etc. I've had a Epson R200 for the past 4 years to print out my album covers and CD labels and it hasn't let me down yet. However I've used so much I thought I get a new back up in case that one would eventually fizzle out. I looked at reviews of the Epson Artisan 50 on line and it totally lives up to it's reputation. Not only does it print out CD labels way better than my old R200, it prints out great pictures too!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: When I move the paper guide to the slot for labelling cd's, I'll often have both red lights come on, signalling an error. There is no fix for this, and being in the video production business, trying to label dvd's, this is SO aggravating. I will have to replace this machine. If something looks too affordable to be true, it probably is.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Print Time
Cons: Hard Setup; Noisy; Software outdated; Too much ink used
Promoted as the best printer for standard prints. My 6-yr old HP does a better job. Advertised as compatible with Apple OS software,not so. Software that comes with the printer is outdated. You need to go to Epson's website to download the most recent software, but their site wants you to buy more ink cartridges and sign up for Epson advertising. If you don't do the later, you get no help. The Epson 50 sits on my book case unplugged as I won't be using it. Waste of money!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I've used very inexpensive Epson home/office inkjet printers for many years to print both on paper and on CDs an DVDs. Each generation has improved in speed and quality. I can print CD and DVD faces, and jewel case inserts that look totally professional - using thick HP brochure paper (glossy both sides) for the inserts. The Artisan 50 is nearly identical to the previous generation SPR-280, and uses the same ink. This is a bonus for me since when my SPR-280 got to the end if it's life I had a lot of ink still on the shelf, and as we all know, ink is the main cost in printing. I've been using an all-in-one Artisan 725 (with different ink) for the past six months and am totally thrilled with it's performance - far faster than the Artisan 50, but with one drawback - it can't handle thick stoc ... k, like business cards, due to a 180 degree turn in the paper feed path. Bummer! But it's amazing on everything else. So I got an Artisan 50 and now can print everything I need - and it more than paid for itself by letting me use the old ink. I give both the Artisan 50 and The Artisan 725 four stars. If Epson made one unit that would handle both thick stock and disks, it would get five. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I used to print greeting cards and so far I am very happy with the product and it's super fast! I have not printed on full-color range; hence, I can't say much about the color quality. Nevertheless, it's a great print with very good price.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I mainly use this product to print on DVD/CD's. I already have an existing printer that I am happy with for day to day activities, but really wanted to start printing some nice DVD's to distribute to friends and family. The images printed on the DVD's are a lot better than I had expected. Very vibrant in color and didn't really notice any lines. The software is very easy to use. Nicely priced from B&H for less than a $100. The only negative I see is that it's almost as large (foot print) as my 3-in-1 printer without the ability to scan, no lcd screen and no card reader built in. But this printer was much less than my 3-in-1 and I wasn't wanting those extra features anyhow! Just need to print on DVD's

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to setup; compact design; photo qual extremely good
Cons: It ought to have a simple storage facility for the CD/DVD holder, perhaps inside the cover
I've always used Epson printers and in many years have had only one problem, which caused me to replace my old unit with this newly designed model. Photo print quality rivals my professional printer. Black/white printing is very fast. The various covers, when closed, provide excellent dust protection. I'm delighted with the device, though ive only had it for a number of weeks. I've yet to try printing to CD but i'll report on that when possible.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: At first I was apprehensive on buying this printer. we've bought Epson before and I was very skeptical with it's quality. But after hooking it up and printing out my first photo with it I was amazed. It's quality was better than most professional prints I have gotten before. For this price it's a must have. Also so far it's pretty good with handling ink.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Overall Quality; Fast Print Time; Easy To Use; Easy Setup
Cons: Pricey Ink Replacement; Noisy
If you're looking for a simple printing that can do it all, this is it. Since we already have the Epson Stylus Pro 3800 for larger jobs the Artisan 50 has been great for all purpose document printing and awesome for printing CD/DVD labels. Ink can be expensive but I think worth it if quality prints are your priority.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I purchased this product for priniting DVD and CD labels, which it does very well, but I was more impressed with the speed at which it prints documents. I would recommend this product for purchase.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
I am and have been impressed with the quality of prints from an inexpensive printer such as this. It is my printer of choice for glossy prints and is a replacement for one that is beginning to give me problems after over two years of constant use. I love the speed and print quality, but downloading the print drivers form the Epson site was not as smooth as I would like. ( I work on Mac's) and is why I gave it 4 stars.
Two minor issues have emerged. One occurs after ink replacement and is an occasional very minor smudge along the right edge. The other is not printing a true black to white gradient that I cannot correct with profiling, and both are related to the age and use and is why I am replacing my original printer.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: This is a great color printer.
Item.Review:
Pros: Accurate Colors; Fast Print Time; Great Contrast; Easy To Use; Reliable; Great Overall Quality; Easy Setup; Sharp Tones & Colors
Prints good on DVDs Colors are very close to those on the monitor Like all Epson printers, it is a ink hog

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Overall Quality; Fast Print Time; Accurate Colors; Easy To Use; Easy Setup; Sharp Tones & Colors
Cons: Pricey Ink Replacement; Noisy
A professional colleague recommended this printer and it lives up to its recommendation.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Good value for the price paid
Cons: Picture quality poor unless you print on Epson paper
I had an Epson R200 printer until I got my new computer with Windows Vista. I had to buy a new printer and I needed one that would print on disks. I picked up the A50 printer online and the 1st one came damaged but was replaced right away by Best Buy. It prints to disks just great but I tried to print on some HP photo paper (which worked great with my R200) and the quality was awful. I switched to Epson photo paper and the photos came out great!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Nice quality prints for such an affordable printer - Epson is very dependable. I purchased this recently for my photo classroom at school and the student's work looks really nice. I'm very happy with the machine and highly recommend it for someone on a budget.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Eaay setup and easy on the eyes
Item.Review: We bought this printer for student disks. We wanted a professional product that would carry our college's brand well. It succeeded so well that out provost called it the best money spent this semester.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Cheap to buy, expensive to refill
Item.Review: I purchased this printer to replace a recently deceased EPSON Stylus Photo R260. We use it to print custom labels on technical manual CDs. The colors are bright and sharp. The Artisan 50 is quieter than the R260 and, to our surprise, uses the same ink cartridges. Unfortunately, this printer and the R260 before it belong to the family of printers that cost less than a new set of ink cartridges - printer cost [$], ink costs $120.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this primarily for printing CDs, although it is very good (and very fast) for paper printing also. It works as advertised. My only complaint is that ink usage seems high compared to other printers that I have used.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use the printer to print pictures and and label cd's and dvd's. It does a good job on these. After market ink cartridges are pretty cheap. It is no good at printing on small items like 3x5 index cards. The paper feed shoves the card through at a crazy angle. Occasionally after the head cleaning routine one of the rollers leaves a track on the paper but the roller is easily cleaned with a q tip. I actually bought this printer as a backup to my original Artisan 50.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I purchased this printer because my R1800 finally bit the dust. I use it mainly to print CD labels. It is very quiet and produces very good results on CDs. Please note that on the cheap printable CDs the ink will smudge if it gets wet. The best CDs to use have the water resistant or waterproof coating that seals the ink in the surface. Over all it seems to be a great printer for what I am using it for, especially since most other options for CD printing run a lot more money.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Really great printer! Been designing DVD covers and printing photos on DVDs since the day it arrived. Prints great on Glossy and Semi-glossy paper. Photo quality is very professional.
Cons: DVD/CD must be attached with a seperated tray.
I have the printer inbetwen a compartment in my computer desk and found that when trying to load paper on the top tray, there is a little piece that gets in the way which causes the paper to sometimes go in crooked unless I reach all the way in to line it up. No biggie though. I also plan on purchasing CISS inks because Epson inks are ridiculously expensive.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice color saturation on the higher settings, extremely fast on the lower settings
Cons: At the lower quality settings, it kinda sounds like a garbage truck.
I was forced to replace my Epson Photo R200, and this printer was the closest match. I already own an Epson 2400 Photo scanner, and all the stores carry these days are all-in-ones! At first I was very unhappy with the noise level- Epson sacrificed quiet for speed; it actually startled me when I test-printed in "text" mode. Using a higher mode & presentation paper, this printer produced excellent graphics (I do a lot of signage), and at the highest photo settings,the results are wonderful. I've come to really like this printer, and Newegg got it to me fast: I ordered it on Friday and had it Monday morn ... ing! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The Artisan 50 is the new version of the Epson R280. I shoot a lot of photos and my wife does scrapbooking which really gives the printer a workout. I owned two Epson R280s, which are the 'old model' of the Artisan 50, but use the same ink cartridges.The Artisan 50 produces exceptional photographs and is very fast. Epson's paper/dye technology is very durable, waterproof, and smudge-proof. The only downside is that ink is expensive, as with any inkjet printer, so the money you used to spend on film developing now goes to Epson for their ink. While I am just a rank amateur photographer, all my semi-pro photographer buddies use only Epson photo printers, since the quality is as good as it gets.The Artisan 50 is the new version of the Epson R280. I had one Epson R280 which worked beautifully ... , then totally died after about a year. I repair electronics as a hobby, and it was not fixable. I bought a new-in-box R280 [...] that lasted exactly three days (no warranty, ugh), and also was not fixable. B&H had a very good price on this printer, as well as a trusted reputation, which is vital when buying anything online. The extended warranty was only $12, which is a bargain and very good idea, based on my experience with these printers.[...] expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent for printing labels on DVDs
Item.Review: This printer was bought for a Senior Center project for interviewing elderly people who want to tell their story and have it on a professional quality DVD. The Artison 50 is a no frills printer that is one of a few that can print on a inkjet printable disk I am a member of the Center and am the volunteer technical advisor for the Video product and have this printer at home. I thoroughly tested the intended use for the Senior Center and had no qualms having them buy their own.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great upgrade at the same price!
Item.Review: My Epson R220 finally bit the dust and I needed a replacement that could also print CD's. After checking several brands it seems Epson is one of the few that caters to those of us who produce a lot of CD's. My 220 printed great CD's but the Artisan 50 I replaced it with does an even better job! The printer is also used to print computer graphic art work and produces very high quality graphic images as well as great photos. The only issue I have is how to transfer all the CD artwork I did on the 220 to the Artisan 50 Print CD software.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: A no-frills photo printer that prints outstanding pictures.
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent lab quality photos, true 6-ink system, individual ink tanks, seems like it's good with ink usage, relatively fast. Best of all less then 100 dollars.
Cons: A little noisy when starting up and shutting down. Not the best looking printer in the world (but I don't really care about that). Text quality is not that great but this printer really isn't made for that.
Got this printer to replace my nearly 6 year old Canon i960 that stopped printing properly.
I used to be very anti--Epson because there printheads are not removable so if they clog, you're stuck.
However, when doing research I found that Canon and HP both have stopped making consumer-level printers that have a light cyan and light magenta ink system in addition to the normal 4 colors. ... Instead they have gimmicks like a grey ink, 2 black inks or even a clear ink. Canon does make a printer that has a true photo ink system (Pro9000) but it's $450 and there is no way I'm spending that much.
So, the Epson Artisan 50 is where it's at if you want a true 6-color printer for not much money. It lacks things like a card reader and LCD screen but I know how to print from my PC just fine. It does what it's supposed to: print excellent pictures and it's fast. Plus, ink usage doesn't seem like a problem. Only issue is the text prints aren't good but I'm getting an all-in-one for expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The prints are smudge, scratch, water and fade resistant up to 200 years. We bought the Epson Artisan 50 from B&H because of the DVD label printing. But we have to buy another printer as we can not use the output from this printer in our work. The ink (using Epson paper) runs if it is even in a damp environment. One iota of moisure and the print is totally ruined. This printer DOES NOT PRODUCE WATER RESISTANT PRINTS. The ink used for our extinct Epson Stylus?? Photo R2400 does not run. We are incredibly disappointed in Artisan 50 and would not have bought it except for the totally false promotion.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: i use the epson artisan 50 mainly for photo printing.I love the speed that it prints at,the colors are great,though sometimes a bit too reddish,but i have since learned how to correct that issue, useing the level,s tool in photoshop elements.black and white photos even print well. on my old epson C88+ though another good,epson product,it didn't print black and white well at all.But with the artisan 50 the tones come out great.It can be a bit noisy and the ink,s are pricey,but then ink is pricey anyhow for any model. I would highly recommend this printer, especially for people like me who can,t afford the high end printers and print no larger than 8.5x11.definitley a great buy.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: I would recomend this for DVD printing
Item.Review: I replaced this with my old Epson R200 printer. The Artisan 50 prints faster and with much better CD-DVD color. I'm very satisfied and would recomend it to all that would like to print professional looking CD and DVDs. It also prints Great pictures on Epson Premium papers.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am just a personal user and use it for limited home uses such as family photos, business articles, maps many other reasons for printing items of interest and for the many albums I create over the years. The printer has worked better than expected and later would probably rate it higher after more use. It is fast and the quality of the prints is excellent. The color choices and inks are perfect. At this stage of use, I do not have items that I would suggest for improvement.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Great product. But I almost returned it when I couldn't find the ink cartridges. After having someone else look through the box, I eventually found them hidden on the underside of the bottom styrofoam. Just be aware.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Needed a printer that could print directly on cds/dvds plus turn out good quality documents. So far I'm very happy with this printer. AND it works flawlessly with my MacBook Pro. Even prints two sided. It looks good sitting on my desk and is reasonably compact. Don't know yet how long the cartridges will last as I have not burned through the first set (the first set seems like the real thing - not some starter set that wimps out right away).[...]

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Branding Tool - Easy to use
Item.Review: I bought this printer solely for the purpose of branding CDs/DVDs to send to clients. I had this set up and software installed in about 10 minutes. It produces professional looking disks by printing straight to the disk surface, no stickers. I would recommend this for anyone who would like to create professional customized disks

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Worse printer I ever had, I put it in garbage a month after i got it, sooo many problems, communication with the computer, printing quality... its cheap and that what you get.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Price; Easy Setup; Easy To Use; Great Overall Quality; Reliable; Accurate Colors
So far I have printed and framed over three dozen 4x6" and 8 1/2x11". The quality is great. The adjustments that you can make to the photos really help.

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: GREAT PRINTER FOR EVERY DAY USE
Item.Review: I BOUGHT THIS PRINTER FOR THE CD/DVD OPTION USE IT FOR BUSINESS FORMS AND CD/DVD COVERS I ALWAYS BUY EPSON THEY ARE SUPER PRINTERS USE LARGE FORMAT PRINTER (3800) FOR FOR PHOTOGRAPHIC PRINTS. THIS PRINTS GOOD 4X6 PROOFS!

Item.Item: Epson Artisan 50 Color Ink-jet printer - 37 ppm - 120 sheets
Item.Review: i got this printer not to long ago.the main reason was that i needed it for photos.i just wanted a printer that i could afford but at the same time with awesome quality.this printer was the one!the artisan prints way better images than your local 1hr photo lab.people usually complain that inkjet printers are not as good quality. well! let me say this...in order to get a great photo, you need to now how to take a great photo, and edit it the best you can in photoshop or some other program.i promise you! that if you got a great photo with vivid colors and with good camera resolution, this printer will do magic prints.also i would recommend buying this paperPhotoImage PRO Matte Inkjet Paper you can get this by going to[@]
